analysis.Summary: Vue component displaying a map section with two MapBlock instances: one for the partner pickup location with an embedded Google Map and link, and another announcing upcoming new places. Uses inline internationalized messages for English and Russian.
analysis.Purpose: Provide a visually styled section on the landing/spot page showing the partner location on a map and informing users about new delivery locations.

Components.name: MapSection
Components.role: Wrapper component that lays out the section, title, and two MapBlock children.

Components.name: MapBlock
Components.role: Reusable block component that renders a map iframe (if URL provided), title, description text, and optional link button.

Functions.name: t
Functions.description: Translation function. Takes a message key (string) and returns localized HTML/text based on the current locale.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Dot-notation path into the messages object, e.g. 'map.title' or 'newplaces.description'.

Dependencies: vue (ref, computed, onServerPrefetch, onMounted â€“ imported but only useI18n is used)
analysis.Usage: Imported into a parent landing or spots page and registered as a section. Example: `import MapSection from 'modules/spots/components/sections/MapSection.vue';` then used in template as `<MapSection/>`.
Notes: The script setup imports several Vue hooks (ref, computed, onServerPrefetch, onMounted) but only useI18n and its `t` function are actually used.
All localization messages are inlined in this component for two locales (en, ru).
The first MapBlock passes a `map` URL and a `link`, while the second omits the `map` prop to render only text.
SCSS styles scope to `#map` and adjust layout, border radius, overflow, and responsive gaps between columns.
